src_text: Mi yella d ATT, iεawen Karter deg usefrek n leqdicat n umaḍal s wudem amesnassaɣ, am Imsisan Kamb Dafid, 1978; s uslugen n wassaɣen ger Marikan-Cinwa ɣer taggara n 1970; Tagrawla n Iran, i d-yeglan s tezɣent n umerhun Irani, 1979; d unbaz Asufyiti di Afɣanistan, 1979.
ref_text: As NSA, he assisted Carter in diplomatically handling world affairs, such as the Camp David Accords, 1978; normalizing US–China relations thought the late 1970s; the Iranian Revolution, which led to the Iran hostage crisis, 1979; and the Soviet invasion in Afghanistan, 1979.
hyp_text: As president, Carter was notable for the Camp David Accords, the Panama Canal Treaties, the second round of Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT II), the return of the Panama Canal Zone to Panama, and the normalization of relations with the People's Republic of China. He is also remembered for the hosting of the Shah of Iran in the face of the Iranian Revolution, the energy crisis during the 1970s, the Three Mile Island nuclear accident, the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, and the Iran hostage crisis during the last year of his presidency.
